intro: Calendula sylvestris, commonly known as wild marigold, is a flowering plant native to Europe, western Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow to orange flowers with a distinctive, slightly serrated edge. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces numerous ray florets surrounding a central disc. Its leaves are broadly ovate with rough, hairy surfaces, and it thrives in well-drained soils in full sun. Calendula sylvestris is often found in meadows, along roadsides, and in disturbed habitats.
